What I should do?
Please using this api: PrintWriter.write.

```java
public static void listFilesForFolder(File folder) throws FileNotFoundException {
    PrintWriter zapis = new PrintWriter(fs2);
    for (File fileEntry : folder.listFiles()) {
        if (fileEntry.isDirectory()) {
            listFilesForFolder(fileEntry);
        }
        System.out.println(fileEntry.getName());
        zapis.write(fileEntry.getName() + "\r\n");
    }
    zapis.close();
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: In your code, you are creating a new PrintWriter object for each file and closing it immediately after writing the file name. This causes the file to be overwritten each time. To fix this, you can create the PrintWriter object outside the loop and close it after the loop finishes. Use the `write` method of PrintWriter to write the file name to the file instead of `println`. This will prevent the automatic line break after each file name.
